alert.note: Alert for Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 10:02PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Butler, Monroe, south central Choctaw, central Washington, Clarke, southern Wilcox, Conecuh and northwestern Covington Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1001 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Millry to 3 miles southwest of Thomasville to near Vredenburgh to near Greenville. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Monroeville, Jackson, Thomasville, Evergreen, Frisco City, Grove Hill, Chatom, Peterman, Wagarville, Saint Stephens, Leroy, Georgiana, Whatley, Tibbie, Pine Hill, McKenzie, Excel, Red Level and Beatrice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox
